alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dawson; Gosper; Phelps (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 11:56PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WESTERN PHELPS...WESTERN BUFFALO...NORTHEASTERN GOSPER AND DAWSON COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM CDT... At 1156 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Gothenburg to near Loomis. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lexington, Cozad, Gothenburg, and Willow Island around 1200 AM CDT. Overton around 1210 AM CDT. Elm Creek around 1215 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Amherst, Sumner and Eddyville. This includes Interstate 80 between mile markers 209 and 260. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
